title: BBC Local Live: Essex Thursday, 26 November 2015 - BBC News
summary: the main headlines for thursday 26 november 2015 : .
colchester united part company with manager tony humes , by mutual consent .
eagles of death metal pay tribute to nick alexander , who was killed in the paris attacks .
jury at the inquest into the death of mother-to-be eystna blunnie returns a verdict of unlawful killing .
essex police cleared in investigation into its handling of lewis daynes , who killed 14-year-old breck bednar .
we 'll have more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: our live coverage throughout the day
text: updates for the essex live page have finished for today - thanks for joining us .
we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow morning with all the news , sport , weather and travel updates you might need .

documents.title: chamber of commerce agrees that trains must improve
text: the essex chamber of commerce has agreed that improvements must be made to the train service , after colchester mp will quince revealed that employers were refusing to considerapplicants who commute from the east .

david burch , director of policy at essex chamber of commerce , said : `` we are not aware of any businesses who have adopted the policy quoted by will quince , but do completely agree with him that services on the great eastern main line are in need of improvement .
`` as members of the great eastern rail taskforce , we fully support their objectives to see major improvements to both the rolling stock and rail infrastructure on the line . ''
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather tonight : chilly and cloudy
text: chilly at first , but often cloudy overnight with mist over the hills and a few spots of rain or drizzle in places .
temperatures will initially fall to 5c ( 41f ) , but become milder towards dawn , with a light south-westerly breeze .
tomorrow will be rather dull and cloudy for much of the day , perhaps some light rain or drizzle from any thicker cloud .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: council tax could rise to pay for essex policing
text: the police and crime commissioner for essex , nick alston , has lobbied the government to be able to increase the police precept by £ 5 a year - something george osborne has agreed .
if it happens council tax will go up , but there 'll be over £ 1m more to pay for local policing .

but changes to national insurance and inflation will still have an impact , mr alston said , and some funding may be `` top-sliced '' at a national level for specialist functions - such as increasing the number of trained firearms officers in the aftermath of the paris attacks .
author: Samantha Dalton
BBC Essex

documents.title: x factor contestants return home to essex
text: i 'll be at the sugar hut in brentwood tonight , where some of the x factor contestants will be performing .
bookie 's favourite louisa johnson and che chesterman , who both come from essex , will both take to the stage .
author: Thomas Magill
BBC Essex

documents.title: 'significant challenges ' ahead for essex police
text: essex police will need to make spending cuts of between £ 10-12m next year , the area 's police and crime commissioner has said .
speaking after the spending review , nick alston said the announcements on police funding are good news for essex , but `` significant challenges still remain . ''
the police force originally thought it would have to save nearly £ 20m from the 2016-17 budget .

documents.title: police officer dismissed for gross misconduct
text: a police officer has been dismissed for gross misconduct after a two-day hearing at basildon magistrates ' court .

pc mark smith , who was based in the harlow and loughton local policing team , attended a disturbance in harlow in january , when an allegation of rape was made.deputy chief constable julia wortley said mr smith `` failed to fulfil his duties and responsibilities towards a vulnerable woman who disclosed that she had been the victim of a serious and distressing crime '' .
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live

documents.title: road rage liquid attack
text: a 41-year-old driver had liquid sprayed in his face during a road rage attack in harlow on sunday , according to essex police .
the victim says he was cut up by a man driving a grey vw golf .
he later wound down his window and sprayed the liquid in his face .
he made a full recovery but officers want to find the culprit and are appealing for witnesses of the incident , which happened near the roundabout junction of the a414/edinburgh way .

documents.title: duchess of cambridge meets essex foster carers
text: the duchess of cambridge met with foster carers from essex last night at a ceremony to recognise their contribution .
catherine was at the fostering network 's annual awards in london and spoke to its president , jim bond , who was a foster carer in essex for 20 years .
essex county council is looking for foster families and is holding a number of events on the subject .

documents.title: travellers asked to leave epping forest college
text: a group of travellers currently camped at epping forest college have been issued with a notice to leave by police .
officers were called at around 17:20 yesterday to a report that a group of seven caravans had moved onto the site .
essex police says it has now issued the travellers with a section 61 notice , requiring them to leave the site by midday tomorrow .
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live

documents.title: colchester united : hall and mcgreal to take temporary charge
text: tony humes ' former assistant richard hall and current under-21s boss john mcgreal will take charge of saturday 's game at high-flying burton albion , assisted by wayne brown .
chairman robbie cowling praised humes , who has parted company with the club .
`` tony has been a massive part of helping us build one of the best academies we 've got , '' he said .
`` he took over the club with one point and kept us up last season against the odds . ''
author: Glenn Speller
BBC Essex Sport

documents.title: eystna blunnie inquest : parents want to combat domestic abuse
text: speaking after the inquest into the death of their daughter , eystna blunnie 's father kevin said that more needs to be done to help victims of domestic violence .
`` we feel that a full and proper investigation into the facts around our daughter 's and her unborn child 's death has been carried out , '' he said .
`` some of the failings that were made have been highlighted .
however , we feel that there is still more that needs to be done to combat domestic violence and abuse . ''

documents.title: weather : mostly cloudy
text: it 's staying mostly cloudy this afternoon , although there will be some brighter spells and we could see a little sunshine in some places .
there could be a spot of light rain or drizzle .
highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: headlines : eystna blunnie 'unlawful killed ' and colchester united part company with manager
text: headlines : eystna blunnie 'unlawful killed ' and colchester united part company with manager
author: Samantha Dalton
BBC Essex

documents.title: tony humes : chairman says he deserves a statue
text: colchester united 's chairman robbie cowling has said that tony humes , who has parted company with the club , `` worked hard to bring through youngsters and we should be erecting a statue to the guy '' .
on finding a replacement , cowling said : `` i ca n't see me going outside the club .
we have good people here already . ''
but he added : `` the way we want the club to work has worn down the last two managers . ''
author: Glenn Speller
BBC Essex Sport

documents.title: tony humes : departure confirmed at press conference
text: the news of tony humes ' departure was confirmed at a press conference at colchester 's stadium this afternoon .
it comes after the u 's suffered a 3-2 defeat to bottom club crewe alexandra , where they threw away a two-goal lead .
colchester have only won one of their last nine league games , and have conceded more goals than any other team in the football league .
author: Glenn Speller
BBC Essex Sport

documents.title: tony humes leaves colchester united
text: colchester united , who are currently 19th in league one , have parted company with manager tony humes by mutual consent .
humes joined the club as head of youth in june 2009 before becoming the first team manager in september last year .
he recently told bbc essex that he was frustrated by his side 's `` basic defending '' .
update : post edited at 13:50 to clarify that tony humes had not been sacked .

documents.title: breakingtony humes leaves colchester united
text: colchester united have parted company with tony humes , after a string of bad results .
update : post edited at 13:53 to clarify that tony humes had not been sacked .
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex Sport

documents.title: eystna blunnie inquest : state agencies 'under the spotlight '
text: essex police , essex social care , the crown prosecution service , nhs trusts and harlow council were all represented at the inquest into the death of eystna blunnie .

coroner eleanor mcgann gave the direction that because a crown court jury had already found tony mclernon guilty of ms blunnie 's murder , a verdict of unlawful killing was the only one they could reach .
a spokesman for ms blunnie 's parents ( the inquest had been important , because decisions made by state agencies in the months leading to her murder had been put under the spotlight .
author: Gareth George
BBC Look East

documents.title: eystna blunnie inquest : family had 'unanswered questions '
text: eystna blunnie 's parents , kevin blunnie and susan mitchell , claim state agencies failed under their obligations to protect their daughter from a `` real and immediate risk to life '' .
they campaigned for two years for an inquest to be held , saying they had `` unanswered questions '' after tony mclernon murdered their daughter .
the jury took just an hour to decide it was an unlawful killing following the hearing , which lasted more than two weeks .
author: Gareth George
BBC Look East

documents.title: breakingeystna blunnie inquest : unlawful killing
text: the jury at the inquest into the death of mother-to-be eystna blunnie , who was murdered by her ex-boyfriend , has returned a verdict of unlawful killing .
more to follow .
author: Gareth George
BBC Look East

documents.title: essex police surprised by spending review
text: a senior essex police officer has spoken of his surprise at the chancellor 's announcement yesterday that police budgets would n't be cut .
essex is one of 10 police forces in england set to benefit from this - they 'll be allowed to increase their `` precept '' , that 's the amount they slice out of the council tax budget .
assistant chief constable matt horne says changes are needed to policing , particularly in the wake of the paris attacks .

documents.title: free parking in epping for christmas shoppers
text: epping council has announced that people can park for free in council car parks in the run up to christmas .
there 'll be no charge on saturdays , sundays and bank holidays throughout december .
it 's hoped the move will encourage people to shop in the town centre rather than in retail parks .
author: Laura Safe
BBC Essex

documents.title: commuters 'missing out on jobs due to poor transport '
text: an mp has claimed that some employers are `` refusing to consider '' applicants commuting on the great eastern main line because of reliability issues .
colchester mp will quince has asked the transport committee to investigate the train route operated by abellio greater anglia in the east .
the train operator has apologised to customers for recent delays and said it was working to `` improve performance '' .
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live

documents.title: eystna blunnie jury about to retire
text: i 'm at chelmsford crown court , where the jury are about to retire in an inquest into the death of a pregnant woman who was murdered by her former partner .
eystna blunnie , 20 , was beaten to death in june 2012 by tony mclernon , who was later jailed for life .
he left her for dead in the middle of a road in harlow , and their unborn baby did not survive the attack .
author: Gareth George
BBC Look East

documents.title: osborne 'listened to feedback ' before tax credits u-turn
text: i asked george osborne , who was on a building site in thurrock this morning , whether he was wrong about tax credits , following his u-turn in yesterday 's spending review .
he said he had listened to feedback and looked back at finances in order to reverse the decision .
here in essex , 91,000 families receive tax credits - that 's about 20 % of households - so it would have made a big difference in the county .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex

documents.title: missing motorist found
text: i 've just heard from police that the motorist they were searching for is believed to have attended chelmsford police station , and has now been taken to hospital .
the force was concerned for the welfare of an injured man seen leaving the scene of a crash in sandon this morning .
author: Richard Smith
BBC Essex

documents.title: essex-born victim of paris attacks 'protected friend '
text: the eagles of death metal have told vice news that the essex victim of the paris attacks died protecting his friend .
singer jesse hughes said merchandise manager nick alexander , from colchester , kept silent despite his agonising injuries to help his friend .
`` i think about nick who protected a friend of his .
he stayed quiet and never called for help until he bled out because he did n't want anyone else to get hurt , '' he said .
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police ask public to search for injured motorist
text: i 'm in sandon , where the police are searching for an injured motorist who crashed in hammonds road this morning and left the scene .
there are several police cars and i 've just seen a police helicopter flying overhead .
officers are asking people to look in their gardens , as they 're concerned he could be hurt .
author: Richard Smith
BBC Essex

documents.title: m25 problems in essex
text: there 's disruption on the m25 in essex , with one lane closed and queuing traffic anticlockwise between j28 and j27 .
congestion is affecting the romford and brentwood areas .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: lewis daynes : essex police cleared by ipcc
text: an investigation by the independent police complaints commission has found no issue with the way essex police handled lewis daynes , who went on to murder a 14-year-old boy he met online .
daynes , 19 , from grays , essex , was jailed for life for stabbing breck bednar from surrey in february 2014 .
three years earlier he was released after being arrested for rape , and the investigation found that was the correct course of action based on the evidence that was available at the time .
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live

documents.title: street lights could be brought back overnight in essex
text: tendring council has unanimously backed plans to bring street lighting back in some parts of the district overnight .
the plans mean lights could be switched on between 01:00 and 05:00 in clacton , jaywick , holland-on-sea , harwich , dovercourt and brightlingsea .
it 'll be funded from £ 160,000 set aside in the 2014-15 budget .
author: Laura Safe
BBC Essex

documents.title: a12 improvements not imminent
text: people in essex should n't `` hold their breath '' on improvement works to the a12 according to john spence , essex county council 's member for finance .
yesterday the road was closed on the northbound carriageway for more than 18 hours after a lorry fire near junction 17 .
the government announced the investment in december 2012 , but so far there 's been little progress .

documents.title: george osborne visits thurrock housing development
text: i 'm in south ockendon with george osborne on the morning after the spending review , where he announced plans to build 400,000 new homes and give help to first-time buyers .
he 's meeting housing developers who will be building the new homes outside london to try and help solve the housing crisis .
i 'll bring you more on this story throughout the morning .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex

documents.title: today 's weather : mostly cloudy and feeling chilly
text: today will be mostly cloudy with a few bright spells and the odd spot of rain .
there will also be light winds making it feel a bit chilly .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
watch the latest forecast below , or you can head to bbc weather .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: early headlines : essex police cleared in ipcc investigation and chancellor visits thurrock building site
text: early headlines : essex police cleared in ipcc investigation and chancellor visits thurrock building site
author: Laura Safe
BBC Essex

documents.title: welcome to thursday 's essex live page
text: hello and welcome to today 's essex live page , where we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county until 18:00 .
if you think there 's something we should be talking about , or you 'd just like to say hello , you can email us , tweet us or head over to our facebook page .
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live
